results.title: Clothing and fashion: a history
results.brief_description: The evolution of fashions in clothing, from Egyptian times until today, is perceived in amusing animation. The choice to cover the body with unnatural materials has been made largely for social status, conformity and vanity. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: The evolution of fashions in clothing, from Egyptian times until today, is perceived in amusing animation. results.title: Poky little puppy
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Little Golden Books Films, Sandler Institutional Films and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about five puppies, one of whom calculates how to eat the desserts of the others. Designed to teach reading and number recognition. For primary grades. Based on the book of the same title by Janette Sebring Lowrey. Consultant Chuck Jones-Animator

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: the Zax
results.creator_credit: Hawley Pratt, Isadore Freleng, Ted Geisel, CBS TV and DePatie-Freleng Enterprises
results.brief_description: A north-going Zax and a south-going Zax meet face-to-face on their journeys and neither is willing to budge. Their stubbornness and inability to change are presented most humorously in this animated film based on the original illustrations.

results.title: The World of the future
results.creator_credit: Peter Thurling, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Hobel-Leiterman Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the changing lifestyles and subcultures of the future, the changing environment and the effect on people, their values and their ability to cope. Includes footage from George Lucas’ first science fiction feature “THX-1138”.

results.title: Out of the mouths of babes
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Focuses on Peter and Jill de Villiers, two Harvard researchers, and their contention that knowledge of a language is innate in humans and develops as the child matures biologically. Includes interviews with both scientists and highlights their work. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.

results.title: From Homo Erectus to neanderthal
results.brief_description: Adapted from an MGM film “The Man hunters”, this film discusses the neanderthal man and Homo Erectus and shows how man’s development has been gradual, covering many evolutionary stages. Suitable for Upper Secondary levels.
